document_title: Grade 3 fatty liver: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Fatty liver is a condition in which the amount of fat in the liver is higher than normal. Grade 3 fatty liver is the highest level, considered the most severe stage of the disease. The amount of fat accumulated in the liver now accounts for 66% or more of the liver weight.
Obese people with high belly fat, people with diabetes or high cholesterol, etc. are at high risk of developing fatty liver. If not detected early, the disease can easily turn into level 3 fatty liver.
The amount of excess fat in the liver in level 3 fatty liver can reach more than 66% of liver weight
